title: [BUG] Progress Bar looks worse in newer versions (on windows)
body:
**Describe the bug**
The progressbar looks worse in newer versions (I tested v9.3.0 and v4.2.2) since it consists out of multiple seperate lines instead of a single, continuos line (worked fine in earlier versions).
Also, you can see in the pictures that in version 4.2.2, a question was printed as "[?]", while in 9.3.0, it became "[[?]]".

**To Reproduce**
I use rich in my project unsilence (https://github.com/lagmoellertim/unsilence), that's where the images come from, rich is used in this file (https://github.com/lagmoellertim/unsilence/blob/master/unsilence/command_line/EntryPoint.py). I ran it on Windows 10 version 20H2. 

**Platform**
Here are some examples (all run on Windows 10).
The upper row is an overview of multiple rich components (with finished progressbar), the lower row is always a picture of an unfinished progress bar.
